item.title: Rugby 2nd XV lose close game
item.author: Joseph Bowden,
item.description: Imperial’s 2nd team made the long journey to Kent to play Christchurch Canterbury, looking to rectify last week’s game which by all rights should have been won. Imperial clearly coped better with the delayed start as they had the upper hand in the early exchanges, which resulted in Tom Mavin making …

item.title: Imperial Rugby 1st XV can’t prevent defeat to RUMS
item.author: Joseph Bowden,
item.description: The unbeaten ICURFC boys proudly journeyed all the way out to North London to challenge the medics of UCL – officially the RUMS rugby club – in what was sure to be a crucial, possibly title-deciding fixture. All was faring well on the Imperial boys’ quest to become men as Coach Rich was seen to have …
